taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section hispidi;species vagulus;

treatment.description: Differing from nos. 61 and 62 in more abundant glands on the primocane and the flowering shoots; primocane-leaflets 3, glabrous; the terminal leaflet broadly elliptic-obovate, with short bluntish tip, coarsely dentate; 3-foliolate floricane-leaves with subacute elliptic leaflets, the upper bracteal leaves simple and equaling the very bristly and glandular suberect pedicels of the almost virgate leafy raceme; fruit very small.
